body_html:
Environment info

Operating System:CentOS 3.10

  1. TF_BINARY_URL=https://storage.googleapis.com/tensorflow/linux/cpu/tensorflow-0.10.0rc0-cp27-none-linux_x86_64.whl
  2. tensorflow.version: 0.10.0rc0
  3. command line: python mlp_mnist_dist.py --ps_hosts=10.51.145.204:30125,10.51.147.155:30145,10.51.147.206:30133,10.51.81.205:30109,10.51.145.207:30131,10.51.148.205:30132,10.50.85.231:30133,10.51.147.208:30103,10.51.147.195:30130,10.51.150.71:30121 --worker_hosts=10.51.145.204:30129,10.51.145.204:30109,10.51.150.8:30138,10.51.81.205:30121,10.51.151.134:30111,10.51.148.143:30135,10.51.148.148:30103,10.51.150.205:30140,10.51.150.9:30113,10.51.145.131:30116,10.51.145.200:30105,10.51.147.144:30138,10.51.147.155:30102,10.50.216.39:30147,10.51.145.198:30111,10.51.151.135:30133,10.50.145.197:30130,10.51.147.143:30135,10.50.146.231:30143,10.50.146.221:30100 --job_name=worker --task_index=0

Other command lines are similar except the job_name and task_index. I will not enumerate all of them because there are many workers.

I didn't have an accurate comment of the log. @prb12 is right. It seems that the workers are unable to talk to each other. When the worker number is small, there will be no such error. But when the number of workers is more, dozens of workers, connection refused will always appear.
body_text:
Environment info
Operating System:CentOS 3.10

TF_BINARY_URL=https://storage.googleapis.com/tensorflow/linux/cpu/tensorflow-0.10.0rc0-cp27-none-linux_x86_64.whl
tensorflow.version: 0.10.0rc0
command line: python mlp_mnist_dist.py --ps_hosts=10.51.145.204:30125,10.51.147.155:30145,10.51.147.206:30133,10.51.81.205:30109,10.51.145.207:30131,10.51.148.205:30132,10.50.85.231:30133,10.51.147.208:30103,10.51.147.195:30130,10.51.150.71:30121 --worker_hosts=10.51.145.204:30129,10.51.145.204:30109,10.51.150.8:30138,10.51.81.205:30121,10.51.151.134:30111,10.51.148.143:30135,10.51.148.148:30103,10.51.150.205:30140,10.51.150.9:30113,10.51.145.131:30116,10.51.145.200:30105,10.51.147.144:30138,10.51.147.155:30102,10.50.216.39:30147,10.51.145.198:30111,10.51.151.135:30133,10.50.145.197:30130,10.51.147.143:30135,10.50.146.231:30143,10.50.146.221:30100 --job_name=worker --task_index=0

Other command lines are similar except the job_name and task_index.  I will not enumerate all of them because there are many workers.
I didn't have an accurate comment of the log. @prb12 is right. It seems that the workers are unable to talk to each other. When the worker number is small, there will be no such error. But when the number of workers is more, dozens of workers, connection refused will always appear.
body:
### Environment info

Operating System:CentOS 3.10
1. TF_BINARY_URL=https://storage.googleapis.com/tensorflow/linux/cpu/tensorflow-0.10.0rc0-cp27-none-linux_x86_64.whl
2. tensorflow.**version**: 0.10.0rc0
3. command line: python mlp_mnist_dist.py --ps_hosts=10.51.145.204:30125,10.51.147.155:30145,10.51.147.206:30133,10.51.81.205:30109,10.51.145.207:30131,10.51.148.205:30132,10.50.85.231:30133,10.51.147.208:30103,10.51.147.195:30130,10.51.150.71:30121 --worker_hosts=10.51.145.204:30129,10.51.145.204:30109,10.51.150.8:30138,10.51.81.205:30121,10.51.151.134:30111,10.51.148.143:30135,10.51.148.148:30103,10.51.150.205:30140,10.51.150.9:30113,10.51.145.131:30116,10.51.145.200:30105,10.51.147.144:30138,10.51.147.155:30102,10.50.216.39:30147,10.51.145.198:30111,10.51.151.135:30133,10.50.145.197:30130,10.51.147.143:30135,10.50.146.231:30143,10.50.146.221:30100 --job_name=worker --task_index=0

Other command lines are similar except the job_name and task_index.  I will not enumerate all of them because there are many workers. 

I didn't have an accurate comment of the log. @prb12 is right. It seems that the workers are unable to talk to each other. When the worker number is small, there will be no such error. But when the number of workers is more, dozens of workers, connection refused will always appear.
